description: 'Documentation requirements and standards'
applyTo: '**/*.md,**/*.py,**/*.ts,**/*.tsx'
---

# Documentation Guidelines

Maintain comprehensive documentation for the trading journal application.

## Code Documentation

- Write JSDoc comments for all TypeScript functions and classes
- Use Python docstrings following PEP 257 conventions
- Document financial calculation formulas and assumptions
- Include usage examples for complex components
- Document API endpoints with request/response examples

## README Documentation

- Maintain up-to-date setup instructions
- Document environment requirements
- Include quick start guide
- Provide troubleshooting section
- Document Docker setup and usage

## API Documentation

- Use OpenAPI/Swagger for REST API documentation
- Document all endpoints with examples
- Include error response formats
- Document authentication requirements
- Provide integration examples

## Trading Domain Documentation

- Document supported asset types and data formats
- Explain calculation methodologies
- Document import/export file formats
- Include glossary of trading terms
- Document risk calculation formulas

## Database Documentation

- Document database schema and relationships
- Include migration procedures
- Document backup and restore processes
- Explain data retention policies
- Document performance optimization strategies

## Configuration Documentation

- Document all environment variables
- Include sample configuration files
- Document Docker compose setup
- Explain development vs production configurations
- Document security configuration requirements

## User Guide Documentation

- Create user manual for application features
- Document import procedures for different brokers
- Include screenshots and workflow diagrams
- Document reporting and analysis features
- Provide FAQ section

## Development Documentation

- Document coding standards and conventions
- Include architecture diagrams
- Document testing procedures
- Include deployment instructions
- Document monitoring and logging setup

## Change Documentation

- Maintain CHANGELOG.md with version history
- Document breaking changes clearly
- Include migration guides for updates
- Document new features and bug fixes
- Include performance improvements

## Security Documentation

- Document security procedures and policies
- Include incident response procedures
- Document data protection measures
- Include compliance requirements
- Document security testing procedures

## Documentation Standards

- Use clear, concise language
- Include practical examples
- Keep documentation up-to-date with code changes
- Use proper Markdown formatting
- Include diagrams where helpful
- Validate links and references regularly

## Documentation Review

- Review documentation with code changes
- Ensure accuracy and completeness
- Test setup instructions regularly
- Update screenshots and examples
- Validate external links and references
